cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Great Inagua Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the southeastern Bahamas today, forecast to skirt north of Cuba, then turn northwest toward the Florida Keys Saturday and the northeastern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle/AL) late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the eastern Florida Panhandle or Alabama Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for northern Haiti coast, southeastern Bahamas, and portions of central and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (no TS/Hurricane warnings issued as of Advisory #11)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern and western Bahamas, northern Cuba coast, Florida Keys, Florida Peninsula, and northeastern Gulf Coast (FL-AL)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty breezes possible (generally <25 kt) as remnants pass mid-week; significant tropical-storm-force winds not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington, DE given inland track and weak intensity
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–3 inches of rain around 18–19 Aug, causing brief ponding and minor river rises
